description:
Xestia xanthographa, commonly known as the Square-spot Rustic, is a species of moth belonging to the family Noctuidae. It is a medium-sized moth, with a wingspan ranging from 35 to 45 millimeters.

The forewings of X. xanthographa are typically reddish-brown or greyish-brown in color, with a distinct square-shaped pale spot near the center of the wing. The hindwings are greyish-brown, often with a darker outer margin. The species exhibits some color variation, with some individuals having more pronounced markings or a darker overall appearance.

X. xanthographa is widely distributed across Europe and parts of Asia, and it is commonly found in a variety of habitats, including woodlands, grasslands, and urban areas. The larvae, or caterpillars, of this species feed on a range of herbaceous plants, including dandelions, plantains, and other low-growing vegetation.

The species is considered a common and widespread moth, and it plays a role in the ecosystem as a pollinator and as a food source for predators, such as birds and small mammals. Its life cycle, behavior, and ecological interactions have been the subject of various studies in the field of entomology and ecology.
